ci_support_linux_64_numpy1.20python3.8._:
cdt_name:
- cos6
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-cos7-x86_64
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '10'
numpy:
- '1.20'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.8.* *_73_pypy
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - python
  - numpy

about.description:
A set of open source tools to analyze molecular dynamics trajectories
generated from the LAMMPS simulation engine. The available analyses include
viscosities, self-diffusivities, ionic conductivities, radial distribution
functions, among others. PyLAT is written in Python with Fortran extensions
for computational intensive tasks.
about.summary: A set of Python analysis tools for LAMMPS

about.description:
A set of open source tools to analyze molecular dynamics trajectories
generated from the LAMMPS simulation engine. The available analyses include
viscosities, self-diffusivities, ionic conductivities, radial distribution
functions, among others. PyLAT is written in Python with Fortran extensions
for computational intensive tasks.
about.summary: A set of Python analysis tools for LAMMPS

name: pylat

about.description:
A set of open source tools to analyze molecular dynamics trajectories
generated from the LAMMPS simulation engine. The available analyses include
viscosities, self-diffusivities, ionic conductivities, radial distribution
functions, among others. PyLAT is written in Python with Fortran extensions
for computational intensive tasks.
about.summary: A set of Python analysis tools for LAMMPS

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "PyLAT" %}
{% set version = "0.1.1" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/MaginnGroup/PyLAT/archive/v0.1.1.tar.gz
  sha256: 6e8a47e1815ddf17f4cfaf7b1deb392d89dba994b3eea18ba2989ab9155fb920 

build:
  number: 3
  skip: true  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}  # [not win]
  host:
    - python
    - numpy
  run:
    - python
    - scipy
    - six
    - numpy
    - {{ pin_compatible('numpy') }}

test:
  requires:
    - pip
  commands:
    - pip check
    - pylat -h

about:
  home: https://github.com/MaginnGroup/PyLAT
  summary: 'A set of Python analysis tools for LAMMPS'
  description: |
    A set of open source tools to analyze molecular dynamics trajectories
    generated from the LAMMPS simulation engine. The available analyses include
    viscosities, self-diffusivities, ionic conductivities, radial distribution
    functions, among others. PyLAT is written in Python with Fortran extensions
    for computational intensive tasks.
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: LICENSE
  dev_url: https://github.com/MaginnGroup/PyLAT/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - emarinri
